p: In human nutrition, a high omega-6:3 ratio has been associated with cognitive decline in adults ( Loef and Walach, 2013). The amount of omega-6 consumed can modulate the amount of omega-3 FAs and thereby reduce the amount of omega-3 available in the body ( Taha et al., 2014). Adults that performed poorly in cognitive tests had higher ratio of omega-6:3 FAs in their blood plasma compared to those that performed better ( Cherubini et al., 2007).
